description: Creates and returns access and refresh tokens for clients that are authenticated using client secrets. The access token can be used to fetch short-lived credentials for the assigned AWS accounts or to access application APIs using bearer authentication.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The unique identifier string for the client or application. This value comes from the result of the  RegisterClient API.

parameters.name: clientSecret
parameters.description: A secret string generated for the client. This value should come from the persisted result of the  RegisterClient API.

parameters.name: grantType
parameters.description: Supports the following OAuth grant types: Authorization Code, Device Code, and Refresh Token. Specify one of the following values, depending on the grant type that you want: Authorization Code - authorization_code Device Code - urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code Refresh Token - refresh_token.

parameters.name: refreshToken
parameters.description: Used only when calling this API for the Refresh Token grant type. This token is used to refresh short-lived tokens, such as the access token, that might expire. For more information about the features and limitations of the current IAM Identity Center OIDC implementation, see Considerations for Using this Guide in the IAM Identity Center OIDC API Reference.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The list of scopes for which authorization is requested. The access token that is issued is limited to the scopes that are granted. If this value is not specified, IAM Identity Center authorizes all scopes that are configured for the client during the call to  RegisterClient. (string) ---

nested_items.name: accessToken
nested_items.description: A bearer token to access Amazon Web Services accounts and applications assigned to a user.

nested_items.name: tokenType
nested_items.description: Used to notify the client that the returned token is an access token. The supported token type is Bearer.

nested_items.name: expiresIn
nested_items.description: Indicates the time in seconds when an access token will expire.

nested_items.name: refreshToken
nested_items.description: A token that, if present, can be used to refresh a previously issued access token that might have expired.

nested_items.name: idToken
nested_items.description: The idToken is not implemented or supported. For more information about the features and limitations of the current IAM Identity Center OIDC implementation, see Considerations for Using this Guide in the IAM Identity Center OIDC API Reference.
